result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Najja R McCoy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Najja R McCoy appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for Najja R McCoy.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a sentencing hearing. State gives their sentencing arguments. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an adjournment of the sentencing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Updated advocacy letter, filed.
filed.
MODIFYING no contact order, to allow for telephone contact with N.M., signed and filed.
filed.
as to modification of no contact order, filed.
filed.

Defendant Najja R McCoy in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for Plea Hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1, 4, and 5 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Counts 2 and 3: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing. Court orders a PSI with recommendation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights and Addendum, filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.
records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Jury Instructions, filed.
on behalf of defendant, filed.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Najja R McCoy not in court, in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Najja R McCoy not in court, in custody.  
Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Matter remains scheduled for scheduling conference on 6/09/22 at 8:30 in Br. 29.

CASE HEARD IN PERLIM FOR BR.29
Defendant Najja R McCoy in court, defendant in custody with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke; both appear by video. Najot Hira in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Deputy Travis Simpson. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
for reduction of bail, filed.

Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke in court, defendant Najja R McCoy not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant's appearance is waived. State's witness is unavailable, out sick. State requests an adjournment. Defense objects. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
signed, filed.
All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Case in court to address the State's request for immediate relief.  Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court. Court sets $10,000.00 CASH BAIL. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same. Preliminary hearing is rescheduled to conform with the time limits.  Case is adjourned to Br. PE.

Defendant Najja R McCoy in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  Defendant Najja R McCoy in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Annamarie Wineke, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
of State's objection to bail set in ICCR and request for immediate relief, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with N.M.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Najja R McCoy in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Najja R McCoy in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Najja R McCoy appeared by video means with Attorney.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT ELIGIBLE FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 3 AND 4. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

11:07am CASE RECALLED. SAME APPEARANCES.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
